fields.title: The DORC
fields.description: One of the personal projects I coded in Python programing language during shelter-in-place.  Gives new meaning to the phrase, "I made a new friend!"  ;-)  The Digital ORaCle (DORC) takes typed or spoken questions, does web scraping to answer, and speaks back utilizing any of 3 open-source voice synthesizers.  DORC can utilize 2 different GUI's to interact with the user visually.
fields.technology: Python, Speech Recognition/Synthesis, Web Scraping, gTTS/pyttsx3/espeak, PySimpleGUI/wxPython

fields.title: Front-End SmartMeter Data Web App
fields.description: As part of the interview process, a Smart Grid company gave me a couple days, 2 months of Smart Meter Data, and asked me to write a web application to display their data in a way that would be intuitive for their customers, in any browser.  Please see "Info" button in the App for Code Critique and further App Details.
fields.technology: Responsive UI Design, Object-Oriented JavaScript (hand-coded, un-minimized, commented by request), JSON

fields.title: Back-End Web Search App
fields.description: Back-end Web Application coded in a few hours to demonstrate solid, "production-ready" software engineering practices (well-structured, maintainable, modular, secure, and well-commented code)
fields.technology: Object-Oriented PHP, MySQL, MVC, Web Scraping

fields.title: Yahoo! Front Page
fields.description: Non-tech creatives who don't necessarily know HTML, CSS, etc. (both internal employees and chosen vendors) use this application to create content/modules for use on Yahoo!'s US Front Page -- the most trafficked page on the internet at that time.  This Web App by hand from start to finish.  It has a built-in, real-time preview system for both the module being developed, and how the current Front Page (at www.yahoo.com) will look when the new module is added.  An integrated Help/FAQ system is also built in.  At time of completion, this internal tool was also already planned for use by Yahoo!'s Argentina, Mexico, Singapore, and Telemundo Front Pages, as well as by other groups with pages subordinate to both the US Front Page and some of the foreign Yahoo! Front Pages.
fields.technology: Object-Oriented PHP, Object-Oriented JavaScript, AJAX/JSON, MySQL DBs, Yahoo! User Interface (YUI) open-source JavaScript and CSS libraries, XHTML/CSS, and XML/XSLT templates on Unix/Linux/CVS platforms
